page.title: 01Review of Westward Ho!
page.content: Westward Ho!, named after Charles Kingsley's book, was writen in 1863. 75% of this block is covered by sea and 25% is residential or commercial and some 300 acres of commonland known as the Northam Burrows. The last is sand dunes and rough grassland, grazed by sheep and horses in limited numbers and maintained as a Country park with residential Warden. An information centre has been built recently for visitors. A Pebbleridge lies between the sand dunes and the beach. The built up areas comprise Edwardian and Victorian properties, various areas of modern bungalows and houses. A very small shopping centre in Winter bourgeons in Summer months with goods aimed at the tourist trade. There are holiday camps of chalets, caravans and a B&B indusrty. In the winter it reverts to a quiet village atmosphere.
